item.title: say it until it's yours
item.description:
From Tom White’s piece Everything Has Been Said (But Not By You)

Because truth doesn’t live on the page. It lives in the speaking. In the wrestling. In the failing and the finding your way back.

It dies in repetition without revelation, in articulation without authenticity.

Anyone can carry a tune. Only you can give it meaning.

So say it again. Say it like you mean it. Say it until it’s yours.

item.title: How Do I Define Mastery for Myself?
item.description:
When thinking about mastery, for myself, there seem to be two frames:

  1. How do I define what it means to strive for learning, for mastery?
  2. How well am I following that rubric / framework for any given essay?

I think I need to figure out #1 first, or at least have some sense of it, in order to give it a whirl. But I also need to not be too prescriptive. Who knows what’ll happen when I write.
